results.name: Days required to spread gossip to n people.
comment: On first day, each gossip has his own tidbit. On each successive day, disjoint pairs of gossips may share tidbits (over the phone). After a(n) days, all gossips have all tidbits.
a(A240277(n)) = n and a(m) < n for m < A240277(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 03 2014
reference: D. Shasha, Gossiping Defenders, The Puzzling Adventures of Dr. Ecco, pp. 62-4;156 W. H. Freeman NY 1988.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
C. Kenneth Fan, Bjorn Poonen and George Poonen, How to spread rumors fast, Mathematics Magazine 70 (Feb, 1997), pp. 40-42.
